Are you confused with the 3 moles CaCO3 --> 9 moles oxygen conversion? If so consider that you had 3 people and wanted  to count the number of feet present, knowing that each person has 2 feet, you multiply the number of people by 2 to get the number of feet = 6. If you wanted to calculate the number of toes, you would multiply 3 x 10 = 30 toes... assuming all feet and toes are present :) Just like this, each CaCO3 molecule has 3 oxygens, so we multiply the number of molecules by 3 to get the number of oxygen atoms, or the number of moles by 3 to get the number of moles of oxygen...

@ChadsPrep  Thank you! I was confused, because I forgot, that mole is just a number, not a unit. Btw, you make really good videos. I wonder why American educational system is considered bad. At least, it is definitely not about you.
